item.title: Starter
item.dc:creator: @planplan planplan
item.description:
@planplan wrote:

follow mod taharok server guide book

e.g.

Adding Commands: Now that you have a server (your server ), let’s personalize it . The very first code you’ll want to learn is how to make a command. To find commands open client.java, press control and f at the same time. In the box thats pops up, type in
Code:
else if(commandIt should show something like… else if(command.startsWith(" …a word. OK, lets make our own. Open MoparScape, go to help in the bar on top, press help > Item ID’s. A long list should come up. If your server has a food command already, that’s fine, but it’s one of the first things you’ll want to add. In the ID searcher, put Manta Ray. What you put in will be what we’re going to add to the inventory (if your not catching on, don’t type Manta Ray everytime (rofl)). Now, you’ll see two of each item (almost always, sometimes only one (rarely)), the first one is that item un-notted. The second number is the noted item. Manta Ray is 392. Unlike in Mopar where you type ::pickup 0392 1 (just an example) you don’t need it to have four characters. If you still don’t get it, it’s not 0392, it’s 392. Now we’ll add the command. In the client.java file, above the command we searched earlier, we’re going to add some code. To make it simpler, we’ll add 3 spaces above the code. Now, click the line above the command. So if it ends with something like }, click infront of it, and hit enter three times. In the second space (the second spot we hit enter), put

Code: else if(command.startsWith("food"){ addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); addItem(392,1); }
(Copy and Paste)(High light all the stuff inside the code box, press control(ctrl) and c, and then in the client, between the 3 spaces, press control v. This just means you highlighted what to copy, copied it (ctrl+c), and pasted it (ctrl+v) in the client)
I hate tutorials where it tells you what to put, but not why, so heres…why .
else if(command.startsWith
else if means: Don’t do this unless…
(command.startsWith means: “(” is to show what the unless means. What goes inside is the unless. command.startsWith means, unless it’s a command and it starts with. Now, this is honestly newb to newb, as I’m new to coding myself

Read full topic
